result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
11:50 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J. Cota appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Thomas J. Cota.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard. Defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury status hearing on December 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J. Cota appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski in court for Thomas J. Cota.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

1W - Casey Cox, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner
Cross by Attorney Zaleski 11:37 AM

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. Attorney Zaleski objects to bind over. 
Attorney Zaleski is heard and will file a motion to dismiss the dangerous weapon if the future. Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard and requests a different date for the arraignment. 
11:42 AM Court concludes
Arraignment scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:37 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J. Cota appeared by video. Attorney Zaleski appeared via video for defendant. 

Attorney Zaleski is heard on the status.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 19, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:28 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J. Cota appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is heard and needs to call the public defenders office. Break. 

1:42 PM case recalled. Defendant is heard and Attorney Zaleski will be taking the case.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:39 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J. Cota in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count. Defendant states understanding. Right to counsel is explained.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:02 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Thomas J Cota appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State recommends $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
